body.ab: <lb n="c56-0108__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0108.08" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 13th<lb n="c56-0108__main__2"/> Nothing is more painful <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>than when the <lb n="c56-0108__main__3"/> mind has been worked up by a quick<lb n="c56-0108__main__4"/><del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20424__Start"/>S<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20424__End"/> succession of events, for a dead calm <lb n="c56-0108__main__5"/> of inaction and certainty to<lb n="c56-0108__left_margin__1"/> of inaction & certainty <lb n="c56-0108__left_margin__2"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0108.09" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c56-0108.07"/>the dead calmness<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>which follows<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20456__Start"/>which<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20456__End"/>and<lb n="c56-0108__main__6"/> deprives the <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20468__Start"/>mind<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20468__End"/>soul both of hope or fear. <lb n="c56-0108__main__7"/> Justine died— She rested. <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20479__Start"/>But<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20479__End"/>& I was alive <lb n="c56-0108__main__8"/> the blood flowed freely in my veins but <lb n="c56-0108__main__9"/> a weight of despair & remorse pressed <lb n="c56-0108__main__10"/> on my heart which nothing could remove–<lb n="c56-0108__main__11"/> our house was a house of mourning– <lb n="c56-0108__main__12"/> My fathers health was deeply shaken by <lb n="c56-0108__main__13"/> the horror of the recent events; Eliza<lb n="c56-0108__main__14"/>beth was sad and desponding– She no longer <lb n="c56-0108__main__15"/> took delight in her ordinary occupa<lb n="c56-0108__main__16"/>tions all pleasure seemed to her sacri<lb n="c56-0108__main__17"/>ledge towards the dead— eternal woe <lb n="c56-0108__main__18"/> and tears she then thought was the <lb n="c56-0108__main__19"/> just tribute she ought to pay to inno<lb n="c56-0108__main__20"/>cence thus blasted &<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20534__Start"/>destroyed<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20534__End"/>Sleep fled <lb n="c56-0108__main__21"/> from my eyes. I wandered like an <lb n="c56-0108__main__22"/> evil spirit for I <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20548__Start"/>done<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20548__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had committed deeds of mischief beyond <lb n="c56-0108__main__23"/> description <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>horrible, and <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20571__Start"/>hor<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20571__End"/> more much more (I <lb n="c56-0108__main__24"/> persuaded my self) was yet in store. <lb n="c56-0108__main__25"/> Yet my heart overflowed with kind<lb n="c56-0108__main__26"/>ness and <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20588__Start"/>benevolence<del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20588__End"/>goodness – I had begun life <lb n="c56-0108__main__27"/> with benevolent intentions and thirsted for <lb n="c56-0108__main__28"/> the moment when I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could put them in practise<lb n="c56-0109__main__1"/> and make myself useful to my fellow <lb n="c56-0109__main__2"/> beings. <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20619__Start"/>But<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20619__End"/><mdel>n</mdel>Now all was blasted; Instead <lb n="c56-0109__main__3"/> of seren<mdel>e</mdel>ity of conscience which allowed me <lb n="c56-0109__main__4"/> to look back on my actions with self satis<lb n="c56-0109__main__5"/>faction, and from thence <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to gather promise of new hopes like <lb n="c56-0109__main__6"/> gay-sweet-smelling flowers to spring up <lb n="c56-0109__main__7"/> with regard to futurity. I was seized by <lb n="c56-0109__main__8"/> remorse and guilt, and hurried away <lb n="c56-0109__main__9"/> to a hell <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20689__Start"/>no tongue<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20689__End"/>of intense tortures such as no language can <lb n="c56-0109__main__10"/> describe.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0109__main__11"/> This state of mind <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20705__Start"/>allt<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20705__End"/><del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20708__Start"/>altered<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20708__End"/>preyed upon my health <lb n="c56-0109__main__12"/> which had <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20719__Start"/>nearly<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20719__End"/>entirely recovered from the <lb n="c56-0109__main__13"/> first shock it had sustained. I shunned <lb n="c56-0109__main__14"/> the face of man; all sound of joy or <lb n="c56-0109__main__15"/> complacency was torture to me; Solitude <lb n="c56-0109__main__16"/> was my only consolation deep, dark, <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20738__Start"/>night<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20738__End"/><lb n="c56-0109__main__17"/> death-like solitude. My father observed <lb n="c56-0109__main__18"/> with pain <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20748__Start"/>how<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20748__End"/>the alteration perceptible in my dispositions & habits, <lb n="c56-0109__main__19"/><del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20756__Start"/>were altered<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20756__End"/> and endeavoured to reason <lb n="c56-0109__main__20"/> with me on the folly of giving way to immo<lb n="c56-0109__main__21"/>derate grief. "Do you think, Victor" said he <lb n="c56-0109__main__22"/> "That I do not suffer also– no one <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could love<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20780__Start"/>d<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20780__End"/><lb n="c56-0109__main__23"/> a child more than I <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20788__Start"/>did<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20788__End"/>loved your brother– <lb n="c56-0109__main__24"/> (<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20797__Start"/>and<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20797__End"/> tears came <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20800__Start"/>into<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20800__End"/> into his eyes as he <lb n="c56-0109__main__25"/> said this) but is it not <mdel>th</mdel><del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20814__Start"/>our<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20814__End"/>a duty not to <lb n="c56-0109__main__26"/> add to the grief of<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20827__Start"/>owed<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20827__End"/> to the<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20830__Start"/>ir<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20830__End"/> survivors <lb n="c56-0109__main__27"/><del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20837__Start"/>not<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20837__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>to</mdel><del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20848__Start"/>add to<del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20848__End"/><lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__1"/> that we <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__2"/> should re<lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__3"/>frain from <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__4"/><del loc="c56-0109__left_margin__d1e20867__Start"/>adding to<del loc="c56-0109__left_margin__d1e20867__End"/><lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__5"/> augmenting their unhappiness by an appear<lb n="c56-0109__main__28"/>ance of immoderate grief. It is also a duty <lb n="c56-0109__main__29"/> owed to yourself; for excessive sorrow <lb n="c56-0109__main__30"/> prevents improvement or enjoyment, or <lb n="c56-0109__main__31"/> even the discharge of dayly usefullness <lb n="c56-0109__main__32"/> without which no man is fit for<lb n="c56-0110__main__1"/> society."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0110__main__2"/> This advice, although good, was utterly inna<lb n="c56-0110__main__3"/>plicable to my case; I should have been <lb n="c56-0110__main__4"/> the first to hide my grief and console <lb n="c56-0110__main__5"/> my friends if remorse had not mingled its <lb n="c56-0110__main__6"/> bitterness with my other sensations. Now <lb n="c56-0110__main__7"/> I could only answer my father with a <lb n="c56-0110__main__8"/> look of despair and endeavour to <lb n="c56-0110__main__9"/> hide myself from his view. About this <lb n="c56-0110__main__10"/> time <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20927__Start"/>also<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20927__End"/> we retired to our house at <lb n="c56-0110__main__11"/> Belrive. This <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20932__Start"/>chal<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20932__End"/> change was very <lb n="c56-0110__main__12"/> agreable to me in particular. The <lb n="c56-0110__main__13"/> shutting of the gates of the town regularly <lb n="c56-0110__main__14"/> at ten o'clock and the impossibility of <lb n="c56-0110__main__15"/><del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20945__Start"/>stay<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20945__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20952__Start"/>ing<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20952__End"/><lb n="c56-0110__left_margin__1"/>remaining on the lake after that hour <lb n="c56-0110__main__16"/> rendered our residence within the <lb n="c56-0110__main__17"/> walls of Geneva very irksome to me. <lb n="c56-0110__main__18"/> I was now free: often, after the rest of <lb n="c56-0110__main__19"/> the family had retired for the night <lb n="c56-0110__main__20"/> I took the boat and passed the <lb n="c56-0110__main__21"/> night upon the water: sometimes <lb n="c56-0110__main__22"/> with my sails set I was carried by the <lb n="c56-0110__main__23"/> wind and sometimes after <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20982__Start"/>wo<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20982__End"/> rowing <lb n="c56-0110__main__24"/> into the middle of the lake I left the <lb n="c56-0110__main__26"/><del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e21005__Start"/>followed<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e21005__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0110__left_margin__1"/>gave way to my own miserable reflections. <lb n="c56-0110__main__27"/> I was often tempted <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e21026__Start"/>w<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e21026__End"/> when all was <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e21031__Start"/>quiet<del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e21031__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>at peace<lb n="c56-0110__main__28"/> around me and I the only unquiet <lb n="c56-0110__main__29"/> thing that wandered restless in a scene<lb n="c56-0111__main__1"/> so beautiful & heavenly; if I except <lb n="c56-0111__main__2"/> alone some bat, or the<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>frogs, whose harsh and <lb n="c56-0111__main__3"/> interrupted croaking <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21071__Start"/>of the frogs<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21071__End"/><del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21075__Start"/>which<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21075__End"/>was<lb n="c56-0111__main__4"/><del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21083__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21083__End"/> heard only when I approached the <lb n="c56-0111__main__5"/> shore; often I say, I was tempted to <lb n="c56-0111__main__6"/> plunge into the <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21094__Start"/>still and<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21094__End"/> silent lake <lb n="c56-0111__main__7"/><del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21100__Start"/>and let<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21100__End"/>that the waters<metamark function="insert">>^</metamark>might close over me &<lb n="c56-0111__main__8"/> my calamities for ever. But I was <lb n="c56-0111__main__9"/> restrained when I thought of the heroic <lb n="c56-0111__main__10"/>&suffering Elizabeth whom I tenderly <lb n="c56-0111__main__11"/> loved, and whose existence was bound <lb n="c56-0111__main__12"/> up in mine. And then I thought also <lb n="c56-0111__main__13"/> of my father and surviving brother; <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21132__Start"/>And<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21132__End"/><lb n="c56-0111__main__14"/> should I not by my base desertion leave <lb n="c56-0111__main__15"/> them exposed & unprotected to the <lb n="c56-0111__main__16"/> mali<mdel>s</mdel>ce of the fiend <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21152__Start"/>I<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21152__End"/> whom I had <lb n="c56-0111__main__17"/> let lose among them? At these <lb n="c56-0111__main__18"/> moments I wept bitterly and wished <lb n="c56-0111__main__19"/> that peace would revisit my mind <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0111.02">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0111__left_margin__1"/><del loc="c56-0111__left_margin__d1e21169__Start"/>if<del loc="c56-0111__left_margin__d1e21169__End"/> only —<lb n="c56-0111__main__20"/> that I might afford them consolation <lb n="c56-0111__main__21"/> and happiness — but that could not <lb n="c56-0111__main__22"/> be: remorse <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21182__Start"/>took away<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21182__End"/>extinguished every hope— <lb n="c56-0111__main__23"/> I had been the <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21193__Start"/>cause<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21193__End"/>author of unalterable <lb n="c56-0111__main__24"/> evil, and I lived in daily fear that <lb n="c56-0111__main__25"/> the dæmonof some new wickedness <lb n="c56-0111__main__26"/> whichlet the monster whom I had <lb n="c56-0111__main__27"/> created might <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21223__Start"/>commit<del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e21223__End"/>perpetratesome new wickedness. –I had anobscure feeling <lb n="c56-0111__main__28"/> that all was not over, and that <lb n="c56-0111__main__29"/> he would still commit some signal<lb n="c56-0112__main__1"/><del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21252__Start"/>cr<del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21252__End"/> crime which by its enormity would <lb n="c56-0112__main__2"/><lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__1"/>almost efface the recollection of the past. <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0112.02">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>There was <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__2"/> always scope <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__3"/> for fear so <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__4"/> long as any <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__5"/> thing that <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__6"/> I loved remained <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__7"/> alive. My <lb n="c56-0112__main__3"/> abhorrence of this fiend cannot be <lb n="c56-0112__main__4"/> conceived – When I thought of him I <lb n="c56-0112__main__5"/> gnashed my teeth my eyes became inflam<lb n="c56-0112__main__6"/>ed and I ardently wished to extinguish <lb n="c56-0112__main__7"/> that life which I had so thoughtlessly <lb n="c56-0112__main__8"/> bestowed. When I <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21307__Start"/>though<del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21307__End"/> reflected on his <lb n="c56-0112__main__9"/> crimes and malice, my hatred and <lb n="c56-0112__main__10"/> revenge burst all bounds of moderation <lb n="c56-0112__main__11"/>I wished but to see him again that I <lb n="c56-0112__main__12"/> might I would have made a pilgrimage <lb n="c56-0112__main__13"/> to the highestpeak of the Andes could I when there <lb n="c56-0112__main__14"/> have precipitated him to their <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21331__Start"/>foot<del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21331__End"/>base; I <lb n="c56-0112__main__15"/> wished but to see him again that <lb n="c56-0112__main__16"/> I might wreak the utmost extent of <lb n="c56-0112__main__17"/> anger on his head and avenge the <lb n="c56-0112__main__18"/> deaths of William and Justine.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0112__main__19"/> Our house was <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21352__Start"/>now<del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21352__End"/> the house <lb n="c56-0112__main__20"/> of mourning, my father's health was deeply <lb n="c56-0112__main__21"/> shaken by the horror of the recent <lb n="c56-0112__main__22"/> events. Elizabeth was sad and desponding <lb n="c56-0112__main__23"/> she no longer took delight in her <lb n="c56-0112__main__24"/> ordinary occupations; all pleasure seemed <lb n="c56-0112__main__25"/> to her sacriledge towards the dead; eter<lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__1"/><metamark>=</metamark>nal<lb n="c56-0112__main__26"/> woe and tea<mdel>s</mdel>rs she then thought was the <lb n="c56-0112__main__27"/> just tribute she should pay to innocence <lb n="c56-0112__main__28"/> so blasted and destroyed. She was no longer <lb n="c56-0112__main__29"/> that happy creature <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21395__Start"/>she had been when<del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e21395__End"/><lb n="c56-0113__main__1"/><del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21403__Start"/>last saw her<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21403__End"/><lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__1"/> who in earlier <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__2"/> youth had <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21416__Start"/>– <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21420__Start"/>who<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21420__End"/>had<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21416__End"/> wandered with <lb n="c56-0113__main__2"/><del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21428__Start"/>on<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21428__End"/> me on the banks of the lake <lb n="c56-0113__main__3"/> and talked with extacy of our future <lb n="c56-0113__main__4"/> prospects– She <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21438__Start"/>was<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21438__End"/>had become grave, and often <lb n="c56-0113__main__5"/><del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21448__Start"/>talked<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21448__End"/><lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__1"/>conversed of the inconstancy of fortune <lb n="c56-0113__main__6"/> and the instability of human life— <lb n="c56-0113__main__7"/> "When I reflect, my dear Cousin," she said "on <lb n="c56-0113__main__8"/> the miserable death of Justine Moritz, I <lb n="c56-0113__main__9"/> no longer see <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21468__Start"/>things<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21468__End"/> the world and its <lb n="c56-0113__main__10"/> works in the same light as they before <lb n="c56-0113__main__11"/> appeared to <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me. Before – <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21488__Start"/>Stories<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21488__End"/>I looked upon the accounts of vice <lb n="c56-0113__main__12"/> and injustice that I read in books or heard <lb n="c56-0113__main__13"/> from others as tales of ancient days or <lb n="c56-0113__main__14"/> imaginary evils;<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0113.06">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>At least they <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__2"/> were remote, <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__3"/> and more <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__4"/> familiar to the <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__5"/> beli reason than <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__6"/> to imagination but now misery has <lb n="c56-0113__main__15"/> come home and men appear to me as <lb n="c56-0113__main__16"/> monsters thirsting for each others blood. <lb n="c56-0113__main__17"/> Yet I am certainly unjust.–Every one <lb n="c56-0113__main__18"/> believed that poor girl to be guilty, and <lb n="c56-0113__main__19"/> if she <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21548__Start"/>had<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21548__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could have committed the crime for which she suffered, assuredly she would <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21560__Start"/>she not<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21560__End"/> have been <lb n="c56-0113__main__20"/> the most depraved of <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>human creatures. For the <lb n="c56-0113__main__21"/> sake of a few jewels to have murdered <lb n="c56-0113__main__22"/> the son of her benefactor & friend, a child <lb n="c56-0113__main__23"/> whom she had nursed from its birth <lb n="c56-0113__main__24"/> and appeared to love as if it had been <lb n="c56-0113__main__25"/><del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21585__Start"/>its<del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21585__End"/> her own.
